meanings.definition: To bring (swallowed food) up again to the mouth.
meanings.sent1: The bird regurgitated the food to feed its chicks.
meanings.sent2: After eating too quickly, he regurgitated his meal.
meanings.sent3: The magician regurgitated a whole egg, astonishing the audience.
meanings.sent4: She regurgitated the information in the meeting without understanding it.
meanings.sent5: The volcano regurgitated molten lava, creating a fiery spectacle.

meanings.definition: To repeat (information) without analyzing or comprehending it.
meanings.sent1: During the exam, he regurgitated the facts without truly understanding them.
meanings.sent2: The student regurgitated the memorized answers during the test.
meanings.sent3: The robot regurgitated the same response to every question, amusing the crowd.
meanings.sent4: The politician regurgitated the same speech at every rally, lacking originality.
meanings.sent5: The parrot regurgitated the phrases it had heard, mimicking its owner perfectly.
